reviews.review_msg: Dr. Wiley is a great prof. Class is manageable as there are only 2 papers (which are easy), midterm + final. Lectures are good, readings aren't too long. TA marks harshly and the midterm + final are super hard: lots of questions without enough time given, tested on specific things rather than applying theory. Lots of theories to learn. Great prof.

Professor Wiley was super caring about her students and made our 8am classes engaging most of the time. The content was fairly easy, but the TA markings were brutal. Other than that, it was a pretty good course.

This is generally average difficulty. Take good lecture notes and read the textbook and you should be able to do well. Stephanie has a nice personality and tries her best to add personal knowledge and experiences to lectures. The textbook was quite interesting and each chapter was generally quite short so the information is not overwhelming.

Stephanie is a really nice prof and gives good lectures that aren't too content heavy. The course is pretty much just theory but not too bad if you come to class. The paper prompts were unlike the average crim paper, but this was kind of nice because it allowed a new way to think of theory and apply it. Going to office hour is a must for feedback

Meh, I agree with everyone, the grading on the papers were weird. I usually receive A-'s on papers and I just barely received a B+'s on both. The TA gave me the same feedback as last time, when I know I should have improved by at least 2%. The final exam is extremely fair, but the class is not that memorable.

Not a hard classes. Stephanie's lectures are short and explain the details of the theories in this course. Course has 2 papers and 1 final. Grading criteria for paper was super clear and specific but the marking depends heavily on the TA. Final was open book and similar to the quizzes.

Wouldn't recommend this class- The professor and both of the TAs marks paper how they feel like it without following the criteria. I did poorly on my first paper so I followed TA feedback on how to improve my paper. As results, I got the same mark as last time, but even lower. Can't trust those people these days. Including them.

Good professor. Her quizzes will be easy if you read the textbook and watch the lectures. The discussion posts were marked harshly, and there was not a clear criteria set of what they expect. She also expected a lot of detail from the papers but only gave a few pages to write them.

Good professor, with concise and easy to understand lectures. Focusses on overall concepts and your general understanding of the course content rather than nitty gritty details which I liked. One of the toughest graders I've had for a first year course though. Overall, good professor.

Really nice prof, and nice TA, both accessible and engaged in the course. I had an issue with how the marking is a bit harsh, however, that's how you learn I guess. if you take this class, do not join a GC full of first years, they complain and COMPLAIN. p.s I'm a first-year myself.

I really enjoyed Dr. Wiley's lectures as they were short and concise. The class material isn't very difficult and her discussion questions in tutorial were related to the textbook. My problem with Dr. Wiley lies in the lack of communication between her and the TA's. She is a tough marker, but the grading is consistent.

She is a good prof and is really nice. She makes you work REALLY hard for a good mark. Quiz questions will be very specific, and discussions are marked pretty harshly. One negative thing about this class was she (or the TAs) did not really give any feedback back.

Stephanie is a friendly prof, but the course requires 2 papers. The quizzes and the discussions will be fine if you put effort into the readings, but her papers are the worst grades I've ever gotten. She barely gives any instructions and a vague rubric, to which she says it's 'not her job to tell you what to write". Not recommended for electives.

Lectures are short and easy to follow. Questions on the quizzes are a pretty specific but you are able to do well if you simply just read the text and take notes. Weekly discussions (out of 2 marks) are a waste of time and are unfairly marked. It feels as if the TAs just randomly give you a 1.5 or 2 depending on their mood. Prof is insensitive.

Stephanie is very friendly and accessible; shes willing to answer any questions you have. Textbook is easy and straightforward, too. Some students say the quizzes are too difficult/specific, but I did my readings and notes each week and found the quizzes to be straightforward and (dare I say) easy. This is my favourite class! Highly recommend!

I do not recommend this prof at all. Her quizzes are hard and don't make sense most the time. Tutorial discussions are an absolute waste. She make them extremely difficult and grades them very hard. She has two papers for the class which are both very confusing. Overall, I would avoid taking a class with her.

Weekly quizzes are so difficult and have random and specific questions that even if you do study for them you can do badly because the questions are based on unpractical info. Discussion posts are a waste of time and sometimes can't even get the full mark for a small reason. Do not recommend this prof, she is not caring during this time

She is super nice but her lectures are short. They are only like 20mins long online and it makes it hard to learn from her. She really expects you to do the readings because of the short lectures. 2 papers was not as bad as I thought it would be and the final was pretty easy as well.

Very solid professor, with no major flaws but nothing incredibly exceptional. I still thoroughly enjoyed her teaching and could tell she cared for the topics and students. Her grading criteria was a bit under-explained and ambiguous, but she was open to questions. Overall solid professor and easy class.

Stephanie is a great prof. Genuinely kind and cares for her students. TA (Angela) was super helpful, and tutorials really filled in any gaps from lecture. She made the final optional due to COVID-19 which was a life-saver. The content wasn't the most exciting but she tried her best to make it interesting. Would take more classes w/her

Stephanie was super understanding during the covid crisis, making the final optional. She gave informative lectures and textbook was only used during tutorial. The TA (Angela) was very good in helping you understand the material better. Over all solid prof and TA. Her lecture slides are vague so coming to lecture was mandatory. Exams are very fair.

Both Steph & her TA Angela were the best I've ever had. Everything was so straightforward in regards to lectures, exams and papers. Both small papers given were super easy with very clear instructions & great feedback to improve for second paper. lecture was sometimes dry but she had to get all the info in I guess. would 10/10 recommend to take her
Her lectures are well organized and interesting. The 2 papers given were easy with clear criteria. However, the readings are boring, and the exam is very detailed so it is a bit hard.

Super easy class, two simple papers that were very informal and easy marks. Exams were fair and straight forward M/C and written. Shes a fairly decent lecturer and slides are posted so thats always a W. TAs were surprisingly good and went into content of course fairly well. Would take a class with her again fosho

Her lectures were super dry and boring which you couldn't understand if you weren't in the lecture. She drags on 2 slides for ages. She gave absolutely no study guide for the midterm or final and the textbook was mandatory for tutorials. Highly recommend not taking crim104 with her.

her lectures were honestly really boring. she would drag on 13 slides for 2 whole hours. she is passionate about her work. i found lectures really dry and there was no clear criteria for final except lectures. textbook was only used for tutorials and they were more interesting than lecture
Very nice and knowledgeable. But lectures have no material covered.

She's a pretty good prof! Mid-term was super easy. Final was a little more difficult, but reasonable for the course. She doesn't record or post her lecture slides, so coming to class was mandatory. Make sure you listen to make your notes more descriptive. I didn't even open my textbook unless I needed clarification on a definition or something.
Lecture-based exams, not hard just a lot of info. Passionate about her work. Definitely would take again. Papers are easy.

took this course online, 2 essays, online discussion and one final. But the hardest part is that the final consists of TWO essay questions, so i didnt even know how to study for it. Wouldnt recommend it.
Very hard MT and Final, challenging class but somewhat interesting.. I don't know if i'd take a class with this prof again...She's nice though.

This class was quite challenging, but I thought it was really interesting. I always found Charmaine to be extremely helpful. When I emailed her any questions she responded with an answer quickly. I had to work really hard in this class, but I still enjoyed it and would take another class with this prof again.

Her expectations are way too high! The midterm and the exam were around 17 18 pgs long and there was barely enough time to finish!Expects u to write down every little detail about everything! Rushes thru lecture slides making it difficult to keep up!Comes off as rude and unapproachable. Intense class but if u work hard u'll do fine
Her class was very challenging and exams were super long and difficult. I kinda liked her but still, her notes weren't very helpful to prepare exams.

Must be self-motivated to get good grades.. her lectures are a bore; too much note taking; ppt's too brief; High expectations for MT/finals --basically gotta know everything in the text, and exams are intensive ! barely had enough time to finish .. overall, would not recommend
Exams are brutal. She expected too much from the 1st year students.

If you can find a class with Melissa Robert (Stoneman's T.A.) as the T.A. or a lecturer ... take it! Simon Fraser is lucky to have her. She is well-prepared,interesting,insightful, she cares about the students and their level and she knows her "stuff".

Teaching is an "art" that Ms. Stoneman has not mastered! She teaches from the text, her slides are difficult to read and riddled with mistakes and her exams are way beyond the ability of ist year students.Her lectures are designed to impress us with her abilities and are ill-conceived for beginners.She should record her lectures.

Exams are BRUTAL. Do NOT take this class with Lorinda, if possible. Nice person, very polite and happy, but structures her exams in a ridiculous fashion (fill in the blanks, mc, tf, written, essays..), making them very complicated and exhaustion. Avoid the "Crim104 + Lorinda" combination at all costs.
She is a nice person but not a good prof. Too many additional readings for 1st year student. Her exams are really, really, really hard..dont take this course w/ her.

i took the course in spring term and it was the worst crim class ever...she is quite nice person but not a good prof.. there were so many additional reading stuffs beside the textbook and exams were SO hard.. too difficult for 1st yr students for sure.. take dis course w/ other prof.
horrible, horrible, horrible. Her lecture notes are in shambles, and exams are extremely hard and complicated.

Of my three years at SFU, this is the most inexperienced prof I have ever encountered. She gives a three hour midterm for a 2 hour period. She makes constant mistakes in her lectures, and her slides are incomprehensible at times. I think my TA was actually more intelligent than her. She is a nice person, but I don't think she's ready to be a prof.

needs to learn how to be more organized in lectures, and how to structure her exams appropriately to the year level she is teaching, AND most importantly, needs to have reasonable expectations of her students.

The teacher prepared well her lectures. She is very hard on her herself and that does reflect on her expectations towards the students. She needs to ease off on herself and also when correcting the papers otherwise we will see a lot of failure in the class once again due to severe correction. An intro course differ widely from a master degree one.
she needs to post her notes...

She's the prof for this course, not the TA. She's very kind and helpful to students, but her inexperience shows. Lecture is kind of disorganized and it's not always clear what is important to know. I think with more experience and a bit better understanding of the material she'll be a great prof one day.

conducts her lectures like a highschool class, treats students like highschool kids, very passive aggressive when someone is late, constantly side tracks for up to 30 mins at a time and takes forever to go over a slide, constantly talks abut her personal life, imposes her strong political opinions of students as if her opinions are absolute.

pretty boring course, she treat us like secondary school kids, crim102 is baically some random concept putting together, everything in her slide, you can get 100% as long as you read through her slide. Pop quiz is at the end of each class based on what topic that week.
She is a nice person, gave good feedback. The readings were a bit long but the course is very interesting.

Didn't release final exam marks for some reason. Sent out a rude email telling students to calculate it themselves. Doesn't go by rubric and very vague feedback. Didn't even provide feedback for the second essay, just seemed like she gave out whatever mark and doesn't want the student to succeed.
Had no idea what she was doing , all she cared about was her looks and acting likes shes better than everyone

Tests are easy if you study. He gives you a study guide and those questions are literally what you get tested on. If you have a good TA I'm sure the class would have been good or at least DECENT. Not in my case... Never responded to emails. No one ever even showed up to lectures.

Lectures were very boring, often 2 straight hours of rambling and going off topic into very specific examples that weren't relevant. I found it incredibly difficult to focus in lectures, which I have never struggled with before. Out of the 300 people in the course, a whopping 20 actually showed up to lectures. The textbook was well written though.

He's a really nice guy, however it was quite difficult to do even remotely well on the tests because of his unclear expectations (ie the midterm and final  averages were in the 60's range). He was generous with the marking of the paper though, and he does provide the questions for tests beforehand which is nice.

He is a very kind prof and seems to know his content but I think he just has trouble conveying it sometimes and often skips a lot of the slides he posts while lecturing. The course is graded only by a few things and his accent is strong but he tries to work around it. He does tell you exactly what will be on the exams though which is great.

Easy material. Very hard to follow him. He has an accent and speaks super quietly. He goes of topic all the time and makes things more confusing. You have to teach yourself everything. He's office hours are more confusing and he is our TA. Aka we sit for 4hrs every Monday listening to him just talk. No grades posted yet. Wish i did not take

His accent is heavy and sounds like he's mumbling half the time. Provided questions that would be on the exams but those questions couldn't be answered with textbook alone but due his accent, I couldn't pick up any info from lecture making it impossible to answer the questions he provided. I switched to a diff prof

I talked to her about my grades and how she is a hard marker and i was talking very nicely she said that she will help me and see what she can do, next day i received a letter from the Dean to meet immediately because she reported me being RUDE!!. Thanks God that i have worked with the Dean and she knows me personally! Otherwise i would be in troub
Just an awful professor. What is she even doing here?

I understand others' comments but think it comes down to lack of clarity. Packs so much additional info into lectures, there's not enough time to ask questions to clarify so busy taking notes.  Felt sorry for those wo laptop. End up with so many notes you have to decide btwn textlec notes to study. Midterm based on text, final lec notes.
Tests and assignments are graded at a 400 level. Has no knowledge of course content, reads lectures entirely off scripts, unable to answer questions.

By far the worst prof I've ever had for any course. Thank god I took this class in my second year because I would be beyond confused. How can she put so little effort into this class and expect the class to do well? The course material itself is easy but I would not recommend taking any classes with her!

Don't take her for CRIM 104!!  She marked the exams at a level WAY above first-year.  Her expectations on the (mostly written) exams are not only incredibly high, but also incredibly confusing.  You will have to be an absolute master memorizer to be able to get an A on the midterm and final.  It's ridiculously infuriating what she expects of us.
Excellent instructor. Has very interesting stories that are relevant to the material. Exams were easy if you actually did the readings.

Tarah was a great professor. Loved the videos and songs during the lectures she showed. Only thing is she talks pretty fast so as long as you're prepared to take notes pretty quick then you'll be fine because she doesn't post them online. Midterm and final were exact same length and were very fair as long as you study the notes.
Tarah was awesome

Loved having Tarah as a prof! We had online tutorials could complete them whenever we wanted before the due date. Her lectures are formatted well, fill in the blank notes but it is a bit hard to type and listen at the same time. She says textbook is mandatory but I barely used it. Overall, great prof and I'd take another class with her!

Tarah is an awesome prof who knows what she is talking about and is really into what she teaches. If you go to class, actually read and take notes on the readings, and pay attention to the lectures you should be able to do the paper and exams and get a good grade. Tarah is very helpful if you go to her for clarification as well.

Her midterm was hard, she expects you to recite the textbook & lectures. Her term paper was ridiculously hard! She practically failed everyone and expects students to write a full-page essay to appeal a grade & said that her & the TA "reserve the right to lower the grade if wanted". Also, she only gave us 2 hours for the final. Would not recommend.

She was a very good prof, she knew what she was talking about and she loved what she was doing. You need to attend lecture as she doesn't post her slides. Be warned, you cannot write your notes and you better be able to type fast, because was goes very fast through the material. But she will gladly answer any questions. Would  take it again!
Learn how to type, notes come fast and furious

Absolute worst class Ive ever taken. Take it with any other professor if possible. Class average of 250+ kids for our midterm was a D. Biggest regret of my life. This class brought my GPA down. Jennifer Wong treats this class as if it is a 300 level course. Tests are insanely hard and a 12 page paper at the end (which is marked hard).
If you're reading this, take him The best professor there is!!!!

Josh is truly the best professor I have had at SFU. Not only is he knowledgeable in his field, but he also has no trouble relating to his students. He goes above and beyond to make classes enjoyable, yet educational. Although he sets the bar high, he marks fairly and gives excellent feedback. I wish more profs were like Josh!
Josh is laid-back and a great lecturer.  I took this class as an elective and loved it.  His exams are super easy but do require a fair amount of studying.
great prof

very passionate and knowledgeable about the material, cares for the students, engaging lecturer, funny and tells interesting stories. he's extremely approachable and down to earth. final was the same length as the midterm and exams are straight from the notes. id love to take another class with him.  one of my fav profs at SFU for sure.

Josh is very passionate about criminology! His lectures are solid, although sometimes he rushes lecture and draws the last two slides for 30mins. Exams are based off of his review notes. Fairly straight forward, and a great lecturer!
I took Crim 104 with Josh and I really enjoyed it. Hi lectures are awesome and he really makes some pretty boring topics really interesting. Would love to take another class with him.
He is so funny, overall boring class though. The online tutorials are super easy and very helpful.
Course material is pretty much boring. The textbook is almost useless because online tutorials give lengthy yet helpful summaries. Easy marks for tutorials. Exams were fairly easy too.
he's a really funny prof. When I took his class he had made easy online quizzes after every class. if you go through the notes, most of the time you get 5/5.
MUST go to his lectures. Don't bother buying the textbooks because everything is off his notes. He likes to make a lot of inappropriate sexual jokes...overall a good prof =)
He's the best professor i have in SFU. His course can pump up your GPA: easy texts (if you study his notes, and the thoeries). strongly recommend
So knowledgeable about everything she teaches. Would for sure take a class taught by her again.

I just want to come on here and say that Sara has been amazing during COVID, and so accommodating when I have had issues related to COVID in my family. She really cares about us and our wellbeing and prioritizing that over school work :)
She's hilarious. Course is super interesting. Pure memorization. She was also my TA and she was awesome.  You can definitely be her friend! I would definitely take another class with her!

She is very clear and her exams are multiple choice. She tries to lighten up the mood with jokes. you might not like her lectures if you are easily offended but I found her entertaining. She''s really approachable and nice. I MISSED my exam because I messed up the time not because I had a legit reason yet she still let me write it Enough said.
Clear grader and amazing lecturer

If you are looking for an engaging prof who deeply cares about her students while being enthusiastic about the material - Tamie is your prof. To do well - visit her office hours and ask for her expectations.

The best professor ever! Tamie is the only prof I know who genuinely wants to see her students excel. Her teaching style is innovative, creative, and clear. Used her advice throughout my undergrad career and experienced much success. HIGHLY recommend - it will not be an easy course, but definitely worth it. Would take any class with her again!

Her lectures are tedious and she goes FAST so I highly recommend a laptop. The textbook was only necessary for the online tutorials. The midterm + final were 80% verbatim ppt notes, 10% tutorial notes, & 10% textbook. The paper topic sucked, but easy & grading was fair.  Super nice, offers study tips, & VERY generous with her time if you need it.

Tamie is one of the nicest professors I've ever had.  She offers clear explanation and tips for the final term paper.  The midterm + final would be easy for you if you studied.  Her lecture notes are REALLY helpful in my opinion but a laptop is definitely needed for note taking b/c she goes through her powerpoint slides quite fast. Highly recommend
Lecture notes are useless yet the whole exam made from lecture notes

Tamie is the best prof I have ever had. She truly wants you to succeed, and will give you all of the help you need in order to do well. She clearly explains everything she is looking for & gives helpful tips for studying and writing papers that you can use in all aspects of your university career! I highly recommend taking a class with her.

Best prof I've ever had! She actually cares about her students and takes the time to thoroughly explains what she is looking for. Also, she gives helpful tips to succeeding in university. Tamie is very passionate & enthusiastic about what she teaches and makes the class fun by bring in guest lectures. Sweetest lady I've ever met and super fun class

Passionate and fantastic and funny prof. She truly loves the content and her passion for it makes it very interesting. Everything about the class (assignments, marking, readings) are fair. She ever records her lectures and slides so I didn't miss anything the few days I didn't go to class.
The best class Ive ever taken. Sarah is an amazing instructor! Great lectures, clear guidelines, fair assignments, reasonable marking.
Lots of reading and her lecture notes are useless. Nice and kind lady, but a terrible instructor.

Sarahsis awesome. Amazing speaker. Young & in touch with what its like to be a student. The midterm was tough, so she bumped us up & also gave extra credit. Gave lots of detail about what to expect on the final & there werent any surprises. Fun drawing bonus question on exam. Super helpful & caring & accessible. Very smart & great teacher.

Amazing speaker. Expects you to memorize 500 page textbook comprised of theories and theorists for examinations. Doesn't post lecture slides up on canvas. Exams are based off of textbook, additional readings, lectures and videos in class. Most difficult course I've ever taken in my SFU career. Please rethink taking this course!!!!!!!!!!!!

LOVE Sarah. Amazing lectures and makes difficult material easy to understand. I love how she teaches. Very helpful and always available in office hours and emails. Most of the time got back to me in less than an hour. Tutorials are fun and tests are easy (half text & half lecture) but you do have to read.
I appreciate her and enjoyed her lectures and tutorials. I can tell she really cares about making sure her students succeed in her class. I am glad to take her class this semester.

Having Sarah for 104 is no joke. Turns a typical 'first-yeatr-criminology-student' class into a nightmare. I'm in my third year and honestly this was the hardest crim class I've taken due to her hard grading and insulting exams. Beware: she will pick the tiniest detail from the textbook to test you on... GG to me and goodluck to all.

Took 131 & 104 with her. Really enjoyed both. Great lectures. The way she explains information makes it easy to understand with stories and amusing examples. Caring prof too. And clear assignments and fair marking. If you follow the guidelines youll do good. Tests are about half and half lecture and text so you have to read.

The content was very dry. For 104, half her tests are based off of the textbook so that forces you to read. Had her as an instructor for Crim131 as well and she follows the same teaching method and reuses the same stories that she thinks is funny. Would not take a class with her again because her exams are awful.

Lectures were mandatory but interesting and she explains material clearly. Readings weren't bad and she encourages you to come to office hours or email her for help. Genuinely cares about students and tells you what to expect for tests. Go to lecture and do the readings and you'll do well on the exams.

Interesting & entertaining. She has good energy during lectures & kept me engaged. Tests & paper were reasonable. Etutorials were a joke but thats a class issue not a Sarah issue. Offered incentives to improve on the final & gave an extension on the term paper. Always available to help & quick to respond to messages. Very friendly & caring.
Sarah is a great professor that is easy to communicate with. I really enjoyed her class and way Sarah  teaches you the material. She's also very fair and gave us many opportunities to improve.
Pretty disorganized. Only graded on a few things? No midterm and final! Be prepared to teach yourself...
One of the better profs, although she was much harder than people say on here. Don't expect this to be a GPA booster whatsoever
Adrienne is a very sweet teacher who is excellent at lecturing. Sadly, the class was far more difficult than expected... just be prepared to put effort into it.
Sad that she's the best prof I've ever had in my first two years at SFU and she's only a sessional. Fair, helpful, clear, and an overall great prof. I would happily take another course with her
Had her for both CRIM 101 and 104 and she was very fair. She gives excellent notes and is more than helpful. Would definitely take a class with her again
I had her for CRIM 101 too and she was great in both courses. Ironic how she is only a sessional yet she is easily one of the bests profs in the CRIM department. Very approachable and fair

He was so funny and honestly kinda hot but thats besides the point. He was incredibly clear during his lectures and recording his lectures was extremely helpful during  study time. I would 100% take this class again. He is knowledgable and loves what hes teaching so its a great class!

He was a good prof, although the online portion of this course was really boring in my opinion. Exams were fair, but make sure you know the important concepts well as there are many short answer questions and 2 long answer questions. The only time I ever opened the textbook was for the paper - buy it used.

Really enjoyed this course. Nick always responds to emails and answers questions. Just remember to show up for the lectures and take notes (he does not post notes), read this textbook. This is an easy A. Also, papers are easy As, if you put minimal effort.
Very straightforward, easy marking
Took Crim 104 with him, he is honestly the best professor I've had so far. He is clear and quite helpful as well as easy to talk to. Would recommend taking a class with him.  Bonus: He is cute

His class was actually really great. he has a cute sense of humor that makes the class completely painless. definitely knows his stuff and makes class very interesting. only used the textbook once for the paper and  still got a good grade. just study his lecture notes really well. would definitely take the class again just to have a class with him:
Pretty clear overall; however, tests are harder than expected. he marks them quite critically
Nick is awesome! Very helpful but like everyone else has mentioned, he is slow at marking. Other than that he is a big help, always pushes people to come visit him during office hours.

Took crim 104 online where Nick was the T.A. for the class and honestly he is the most helpful T.A I have ever met! Make's everything clear, and the class in general is fairly easy if you do the readings. Would definitely recommend him :)
Nick is very helpful, pleasant and really eager to answer any questions that you have. The only problem is that like others said, he is slow at marking. Other than that he is great!

Hes kind of awkwardly funny, overall great. By far one of the nicest profs I've ever met, always willing to help and super easy to talk to. The material is a little tough, but his slides summarize it well. Unfortunately he doesn't lecture very well, most of the time just reads off the slides and he expects you to know it all for the midterm/final.
Knows what he is talking about during lectures, however his slides are unorganized and can be confusing at times. Overall he's an OK professor

Very clear in lectures but when it came to the term paper he was confusing with the bibliography and citations. He knows what he's talking about and explains everything clearly and ever had in-class revision on previous lectures to make sure the class is on top of readings and notes.

Had Nick as my TA for 104 this semester. He is really nice and always willing to answer questions and help out. He marked extremely fair. The course itself (designed by Barry Cartwright) was great, and Nick contributed to that. However, my only complaint is that he is PAINFULLY slow at marking assignments. It took him 3 weeks to return our papers

Dawn was an amazing professor, her lectures were engaging, making the content easy to learn, especially during an intersession course. The assignment was well related to the content and was fun to do. She provided very clear instructions, making it easy to do assignments. The exams were not too difficult as long as you make sure to attend class.

Exams are closely related to the textbook and videos/cases discussed in class so make sure to get some reading in and pay attention. Tutorials were not bad, they're just based on your participation and attendance. The grading for the paper and other written assignments were tough.

Despite being the most caring and knowledgeable professor, she gives so much homework. Students must read 30 pages of the textbook every week and write a paper about the concept. Every three weeks you have a quiz based on three chapters. Major assignment on a case study. The exams are difficult. TAs are the worse. Took marks off and can not read

Fav prof at SFU. Took multiple classes taught by her in the Spring and had Marjan as my TA (she was brilliant). Paper is straight forward, tutorials are helpful and prof is passionate. Have nothing but good things to say about her. Helpful and understanding and lectures are insightful. Midterm and final is simple, mcq and short answers.

Dawn is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. Her lectures are recorded, but her lecture slides barely had any content so you need go/listen to the lecture. Others say this class is textbook heavy but I barely read it and still got an A. She uses a lot of IRL examples which were helpful to understand the main topics. Good class!

Dawn is a nice prof it's just a pretty slow class in my opinion. You definitely need to read the textbook because the whole exam is based on it. Then she'll just pull the random examples from lecture on the exams. Not really sure how that helps with the content learning. Boring lectures, and the TA is horrible.

Dawn is an amazing professor. Her tests are heavily based off textbook, so you HAVE to read it. Her lecture slides didn't have much on them so it kinda forced you to go to lecture. She is really good at giving personal examples but you need to learn how to put 2 and 2 together by yourself. Overall, she is a very kind with amazing communication!

One of the best professors I've had. Syllabus and grading is super clear, lectures were a little boring but as long as you find a way to keep up with the material (e.g. textbook), it was easy to succeed in this class. No trick questions or tough grading.

Dawn is a great professor. Going to lectures and tutorials helps a lot. since her slides don't make sense if you just read them and she usually does go more in-depth in class. She's very clear with grading criteria and what will be in the tests. Also, you have to read the textbook since that's mostly what her tests are based on

To be honest she seems great and knows what she is talking about, but when you are trying to review her lecture slides, they do not make any sense. SHe also expects you to read the textbook which is fine but I hate how I learn more from reading the textbook than actually listening to her lectures.

Her lecture slides are very minimal, you'll need to read the textbook quite a bit. She doesn't do any exam prep or at least tell us key terms which made studying kinda hard. Her assignments are not too difficult but attendance is important if you want to do well.

Though she barely puts stuff in her slides, making it more information from textbook-based rather than slides, she is a great lecturer! She simplifies confusing concepts, and her tests are straightforward as she goes over the test formats before exam day. The tutorial videos and readings are always on the tests but it is mostly textbook based.

Professor canceled all her lectures, due to TA strikes. all my other profs continue class but i havent had a lecture in this class in over a month. I understand that shes respecting pickets. but complete lack of communication just makes it seem like we are falling further and further behind. I payed for these classes but they dont exist.

Lectures are just discussions between students - there's barely anything on her slides because she wants you to learn form the textbook - so there's a lot of reading ... Haven't taken the tests yet or done any assignments, but I already hate her teaching method

I really like the prof who is passionate about criminology. Unfortunately, her TAs are tough graders and they'll make sure your grade is as low as possible. You will get 2/3 for incorrectly responding to one out of ten parts of the question. Exams on the written portion are extremely difficult. TAs expect you to write like a lawyer. Avoid taking it

the TAs are absolutely terrible; they pay attention to the smallest details. very standoffish, on exams, if u miss one thing out of a 5 point q, you're gonna get a 0. do not take this class; they literally set u up to fail over small things, point itty bitty details and then when u fix it, they give u the same mark. teacher's the same.

The TAs are extremely awful! They are too detailed on small things and take marks off whenever possible. I regret taking this class with this professor because the TAs are shi*. I got A in every low division of crim classes except for this one. TAs are not helpful at all. They should be trained properly.

took this after everyone said she was good, yeah, no. accuses you of stuff you never did, stand-offish, and passive-aggressive when u try to talk and explain. thought it would be a nice class but she def ruined my mood every week, TA was too detailed oriented and gave sh*t for every small thing and took marks off. exams were medium difficult, 6/10.

Dawn is very kind and a great teacher. Course covers many theories and is a lot of writing. Exams are reasonable but you have to know the theories well. Written exam qs based on examples in lecture and mc based on textbook. 1 major essay, 2 small writing projects, deliverables, midterm and final (non-cumulative). Feels like a sociology course.

You need to read and take notes on the textbook material, the exams are heavily based on it and the examples in lectures are critical to remember as well. Overall Dawn Rault is a kind and passionate professor.
